data.text:
In a new series by the City Clerk's Office, The Clerk Chronicles, learn all about Palo Altoâ€™s Office of the City Clerk and the services their team provides. From agenda and meeting management to municipal elections, City Clerk duties are outlined in the City Charter and acts as the liaison between the public and City Council. The first in our series shares information about how the Clerk administers the Cityâ€™s local election process. Read here: bit.ly/3WbOZ0y Mahealani Ah Yun Christine Prior

COUNCIL SWEARING-IN CEREMONY & DECIDING WHO'S DEPUTY MAYOR Now that the local government elections are over and winners declared, Noosa Council has scheduled two critical events/meetings which will be live-streamed so all can watch. The first is the 'Declaration of Office' at 10am on Wednesday 3rd April, which will involve the mayor and councillors being sworn in. They will each commit to and sign the Councillor Code of Conduct and then each will get the opportunity to make a speech. Attendance is by invitation only, including to a yummy morning tea, but livestreaming is for everyone. The first Council meeting of the new Council will be at 10am on Monday 8th April. At this ceremonial meeting the Council will make its first political decisions - voting on who to elect as Deputy Mayor and as representatives on various external boards and groups. Most likely the negotiations about this will take place behind the scenes in advance, so that unanimous votes can result, but if consensus has not been reached, it is possible for Council to vote by secret ballot. For live-streaming, follow this link https://lnkd.in/gsuvXfhk

News alert: the Government has introduced a bill to lower the voting age to 16 in local elections. LGNZ is always open to any changes that strengthen local democracy and improve participation. Lowering the voting age is one of the many recommendations from an independent review into the future for local government. As part of our wider campaign to push decision makers to choose localism, our member councils are developing a consensus position on the package of recommendations in a bid to drive a future by local government. It will be ready in November, in time for a new Cabinet to take office. We are taking a considered approach to all the recommendations in this review - it's a huge opportunity to shape Aotearoaâ€™s councils and communities for the better, so we need to get it right.

Key Ideas at a Glance! Get a sense of the discussion`s content and feel through GRAPHIC RECORDING in just a few moments. Filled with visual metaphors and key-words this `map` carries you through the subjects and the emotions experienced during an event. Once engaged by the visuals, your audience will surely want to look further into your content. Use GRAPHIC RECORDING to make the ideas from your event travel. #graphicrecording #visualcommunication #ideasworthspreading #shareideas #visualpractitioner

Becoming a Board member is both fun and rewarding. You are able to help determine the direction of the Chapter for the future. It also helps solidify your leadership skills. Just jump in by submitting a short paragraph on why you want to be in a particular position, bit about yourself and finally a head shot. #boardofdirectors #leadership #planning #givingback #Rosann767

My liberal friends and progressive acquaintances are apoplectic about Project 2025. Rather than be the end of the world, it is a rational, focused plan to make sure that the second Trump Administration is much better prepared to govern than the first one. What I like is how transparent it is. Lefties, elections have consequences and if Trump wins, his team will be ready on day one. How anyone can have problems with that is beyond me. https://lnkd.in/g7sYM2mk
